metadata.title: CVE-2019-11027 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Ruby OpenID (aka ruby-openid) through 2.8.0 has a remotely exploitable flaw. This library is used by Rails web applications to integrate with OpenID Providers. Severity can range from medium to critical, depending on how a web application developer chose to employ the ruby-openid library. Developers who based their OpenID integration heavily on the "example app" provided by the project are at highest risk.

criterions.comment: ruby-openid package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.2debian-1').
